com.yworks.yfiles.layout.hierarchic

Class RoutingStyle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yworks.yfiles.layout.hierarchic.RoutingStyle

  • public class RoutingStyle
extends Object
    This class is used by EdgeLayoutDescriptor to specify the routing style for different types of edges.
    See Also:
    EdgeLayoutDescriptor.setRoutingStyle(RoutingStyle), IEdgeData.getType()

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RoutingStyle(EdgeRoutingStyle routingStyle)
      Creates a new RoutingStyle instance with the given routing style for each edge.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RoutingStyle

        public RoutingStyle(EdgeRoutingStyle routingStyle)
        Creates a new RoutingStyle instance with the given routing style for each edge.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if an unknown routing style is given
        Parameters:
        routingStyle - one of the predefined routing styles

    • Method Detail

      • getBackLoopRoutingStyle

        public EdgeRoutingStyle getBackLoopRoutingStyle()
        Gets the routing style for back-loop edges.

        This style is used for routing U-turns of common edges (i.e., edges that are neither self-loops nor same-layer edges). A U-turn is a non-monotonic part of the edge route that is required for reversed edges if option BackLoopRoutingEnabled is enabled or in some other scenarios with port constraints/candidates.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if an unknown routing style is given
        Returns:
        one of the predefined routing styles
        See Also:
        setBackLoopRoutingStyle(EdgeRoutingStyle)

      • getDefaultEdgeRoutingStyle

        public EdgeRoutingStyle getDefaultEdgeRoutingStyle()
        Gets the default routing style for edges that have no individual routing style.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if an unknown routing style is given
        Returns:
        one of the predefined routing styles
        See Also:
        setDefaultEdgeRoutingStyle(EdgeRoutingStyle)

      • getEdgeGroupRoutingStyle

        public EdgeRoutingStyle getEdgeGroupRoutingStyle()
        Gets the routing style for grouped edges at the common segments.

        More precisely, grouped edges are routed in a bus-style fashion (i.e., the paths of the edges will share a common edge segment) and this option allows to specify the routing style at the bus.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if an unknown routing style is given
        Returns:
        one of the predefined routing styles
        See Also:
        setEdgeGroupRoutingStyle(EdgeRoutingStyle)

      • getSameLayerEdgeRoutingStyle

        public EdgeRoutingStyle getSameLayerEdgeRoutingStyle()
        Gets the routing style for same-layer edges.

        A same-layer edge is an edge whose source/target are assigned to the same layer.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if an unknown routing style is given
        Returns:
        one of the predefined routing styles
        See Also:
        setSameLayerEdgeRoutingStyle(EdgeRoutingStyle)

      • getSelfLoopRoutingStyle

        public EdgeRoutingStyle getSelfLoopRoutingStyle()
        Gets the routing style for self-loops.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if an unknown routing style is given
        Returns:
        one of the predefined routing styles
        See Also:
        setSelfLoopRoutingStyle(EdgeRoutingStyle)

      • setBackLoopRoutingStyle

        public void setBackLoopRoutingStyle(EdgeRoutingStyle value)
        Sets the routing style for back-loop edges.

        This style is used for routing U-turns of common edges (i.e., edges that are neither self-loops nor same-layer edges). A U-turn is a non-monotonic part of the edge route that is required for reversed edges if option BackLoopRoutingEnabled is enabled or in some other scenarios with port constraints/candidates.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if an unknown routing style is given
        Parameters:
        value - one of the predefined routing styles
        See Also:
        getBackLoopRoutingStyle()

        public void setEdgeGroupRoutingStyle(EdgeRoutingStyle value)
        Sets the routing style for grouped edges at the common segments.

        More precisely, grouped edges are routed in a bus-style fashion (i.e., the paths of the edges will share a common edge segment) and this option allows to specify the routing style at the bus.
